text: Airports Economic Regulatory Authority (AERA) is a regulatory agency under Government of India to regulate tariff and other expenditure & fees for major airports. It is a statutory body constituted under the Airports Economic Regulatory Authority of India Act (AERA), 2008. ==Functions== It works according to provisions of AERA Act 2008. It regulates tariffs and fees charged to airports and passengers and monitors the quality of service. ==References== Category:Regulatory agencies of India Category:Airport operators Category:Aviation authorities Category:Ministry of Civil Aviation (India) Category:Government-owned companies of India
